comments:
I've previously downloaded Eclipse 2.1 for HP-UX (Motif) and I was using it 
quite happily for the past month.  However at some point in the past week, 
Eclipse just stopped working.  When I try to access the Preferences dialog, I 
get VerifyError messages, when I try to swtich to the PDE Plugin Development 
perspective I get the same kind of errors.  

This is a major problem, because when I try to recover by starting with a fresh 
workspace (or when a new developer joins are team), we can't import any of our 
existing projects.  When we try the import fails, because various internal 
Eclipse views refuse to load due to these "VerifyErrors".  Here is an example 
of the kind of error I am seeing:

java.lang.VerifyError: (class: org/eclipse/pde/internal/ui/PDEPlugin, method: 
logException signature: 
(Ljava/lang/Throwable;Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/String;)V) Incompatible 
object argument for function call
at java.lang.Class.getDeclaredConstructors0(Native Method)
at java.lang.Class.privateGetDeclaredConstructors(Class.java:1597)
at java.lang.Class.getConstructor0(Class.java:1769)
at java.lang.Class.getConstructor(Class.java:990)
...

I haven't been able to find any particular root cause for these errors.  
Sometimes it happens right away, sometimes it happens after a couple of clicks 
through the views.   Consistently though I can replicate this:

  - Using a fresh install of Eclipse with read-only permission on the 
    install directory:

    <install>/eclipose -data $(HOME)/workspace &

    * No existing workspace, it goes through the first time install and comes
      up initially with the resource view.

  - When I try to open the PDE Development Perspective I get the above kind
    of VerifyError.  If I try to use the preferences (say to turn on plugins
    that need to be imported in the PDE Target Platform), I get those same 
    kind of errors.

This completely hoses us.  We can't setup a new user, and if we loose our 
workspaces that we had from before, we can't setup a new one...since we can't 
import our projects, because we can't go to the Plugin-Development preferences 
and turn on the appropriate plugins (like org.eclipse.ui.views) in PDE Target 
Platform, because when we try to access the PDE properties tabs we get those 
VerifyErrors.  For example:

org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Failed to execute runnable 
(java.lang.VerifyError: (class: org/eclipse/pde/internal/ui/PDEPlugin, method: 
logException signature: 
(Ljava/lang/Throwable;Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/String;)V) Incompatible 
object argument for function call)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2332)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Synchronizer.runAsyncMessages
(Synchronizer.java:101)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runAsyncMessages(Display.java:1936)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:1727)
	at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.runEventLoop(Window.java:583)
	at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.open(Window.java:563)


I've spent the last three days trying to figure out what *I'm* doing wrong, but 
I haven't found anything and this point I about out of options.  I've tried 
fresh copies of Eclipse, I've tried the latest 2.1.1 build, I checked my 
environment to see if there was some kind of conflict, but I haven't found 
anything that could turn on/off the problem.   The Eclipse error logs are not 
helping me either, since there is nothing leading up to these VerifyErrors and 
I have no idea what the logException method is.  I'm pretty sure I've never 
messed with it, since we don't make any attempt to modify Eclipse itself.

Any possible solutions to this, or how to setup a basic sane environment for 
Eclipse would be greatly appreciated.  As it stands we're dead in the water, 
since we currently have to develop on HP-UX.
Created an attachment (id=4968)
Detailed stack trace of eclipse errors when trying to view preferences window

As a work around for the problems with creating an Eclipse 2.1 based workspace
on HP-UX, I tried using Eclipse 2.0.2 to create the workspace and then turn on
all the standard plugins in the PDE Target Platform preference tab.  Eclipse
2.0.2 seems to work without any problems at all on my HP-UX 11 machine.  Once
the workspace was setup up and the all the standard plugins turned on, I shut
down Eclipse 2.0.2, and started up Eclipse 2.1.  I was able to import an
existing Eclipse project (that was created with 2.1) and I didn't get any
unresolved references to standard plugins.  So everything seemed ok...until I
tried to use Eclipse in a more detailed way.  Having created the workspace with
2.0.2, Eclipse 2.1 will now come up and even switch to the PDE development
perspective without any problems.  But when I try to use the preferences dialog
to access the various PDE development property tabs, Eclipse 2.1 is still
broken.  I've attached the detailed stack trace to show the errors that occur
when I try to access the PDE development preferences.	Since I edited these
preferences to be set as needed while I had Eclipse 2.0.2 up and running, I
think I can acutally continue with my work.  But I'm not exactly filled with
confidence, I have not idea just how much of Eclipse is working and how much
isn't.	I still don't know exactly what is wrong, only how to partially work
around it in a really ugly way.
Created an attachment (id=4969)
Can not do an "Open" on plugin.xml

More parts of Eclipse (than just the PDE Development preferences) appear to be
broken.  I can no longer "open" the plugin.xml files.  This prevents me from
using the GUI to manage things like the plugin dependancies and extension
points.  From the error logs it looks like the ManifestEditor class can not be
loaded because the entire PDE plugin is deactivated (from the earlier errors
with the preference dialog).  When I shut down Eclipse and start it again, and
try to open a plugin.xml file as the first operation, then the error I get is:

java.lang.VerifyError: (class: org/eclipse/pde/internal/ui/PDEPlugin, method:

I have no idea why this would happen (particularly why not right away). DJ, 
have you seen something like this?
While continuing to try and find work arounds for this, I have found one work 
around that consistently solves the problem.  Its not ideal though.  By running 
Eclipse like this:

   eclipse -vmargs "-Djava.compiler=NONE"

I don't have to do anything weird.  I can start fresh with Eclipse 2.1, import 
existing projects, I can jump to PDE mode, browse preferences and open the 
plugin.xml files.  Everything seems to work fine, except that its obviously 
going slow everthing down since I'm not using HP's JIT.  

My (un)educated guess is that some kind of patch was applied to our HP-UX 11 
server and the HP-UX JIT has changed somehow for the worse.  By turning off the 
JIT I avoid the problem (whatever it was).  As I say this isn't ideal, but it 
does seem to get me going.   

I'll try to get our support people to upgrade to the very latest HP version of 
Java (1.4.1.0.02)  right now the reported version is:

java version "1.4.0.01"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.0.01-020827-15:50)
Java HotSpot(TM) Server VM (build 1.4 1.4.0.01-020827-17:12-PA_RISC2.0 PA2.0, 
mixed mode)

For now I've got a workaround, so I guess the severity can be lowered.




Your explanation seems plausable - the errors you are reporting keep repeating 
the method signature problem which is extremely strange considering that the 
same code works fine on other platforms. Without further information, it seems 
to me like a bug in the particular JIT.
See bug 23873.
Check to see if you have another version of Xerces on your classpath or in the 
JRE endorsed folder.

I checked my path, could not find any installed xml parsers.  I'm not really an 
expert on xml tools though.  I know for sure there is no xerces or Xerces in my 
paths or in common directories.  Other people on my team have now seen the same 
problems on HP-UX, and the same work around is working for all of us.

all this xerces-related stuff have been resolved as of 3.0M5 by removing 
dependency on org.apache.xerces
